content.raw:
I have an idea about the reason: I created the fork about 2 weeks ago. When I tried to hg push my changes to the fork, I got the error message. So I looked into the wiki an noticed that the branch has to be created, what i think was not in the list when I created the fork. So I now created the branch but did not again run a commit. 

Is this the reason that the push does not work because the creation of the branch has to be commited?

Is it possible to have the changes in the wiki descriptions marked in the future? I often have the problem that I would like to know what has changed.

content.raw:
If I had to guess, it looks like you may have missed the step on checking out a new branch prior to committing and pushing.

Example workflow:

```
hg branch submitted_models/darpa_x1_sensor_config_1
hg add 
hg ci -m "Model submission for X1 sensor configuration 1 from DARPA."
hg push --branch submitted_models/darpa_x1_sensor_config_1 --new-branch
```

From your repository \([https://bitbucket.org/sopheng/subt\_sophisticated\_engineering\_x5\_sensor\_config\_1/commits/](https://bitbucket.org/sopheng/subt_sophisticated_engineering_x5_sensor_config_1/commits/)\) it looks like you made some commits on `default` .  You may want to start with a newly forked and updated repository and copy/paste your submission into that.

‌

Changes in the wiki can be tracked here: [#!/osrf/subt/wiki/history/Home](#!/osrf/subt/wiki/history/Home)

From your repository (https://bitbucket.org/sopheng/subt_sophisticated_engineering_x5_sensor_config_1/commits/) it looks like you made some commits on default . You may want to start with a newly forked and updated repository and copy/paste your submission into that.

content.raw: The reason was, that I did not hg commit after adding the new branch.
